New Records: France reached the quarter-finals of the UEFA European Championship for the sixth time, matching Spain and Portugal's record.
Belgium failed to score in five of their last six games at major international tournaments, despite 59 attempts and an xG of 6.85.
Key Match Events: France scored a 1-0 win over Belgium with a goal that came from an own goal by Jan Vertonghen.
Aurélien Tchouaméni made 21 line-breaking passes, with 15 in the final third, the most by a French player at Euro 2024 so far.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts expected a tough match for France against Belgium, given their struggles in the group stage.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps acknowledged the need for better performance but highlighted the importance of the win.
Belgium's manager Domenico Tedesco made changes during the match, moving Kevin De Bruyne forward, but it didn't yield a win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France's ability to grind out wins is valuable, but they sleepwalked into the quarters.
The match was a microcosm of both teams' campaigns, with poor shot conversion records.
Others: The match was a Euro 2024 last-16 clash at Düsseldorf Arena.
